result.execSummary:
The defendant Magdiel J Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law, within 10 days of today's date, and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.   Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation.

supervisions.notes: CORRECTED 09-19-2018 TO LIST THE CORRECT AMOUNT OF CFTS

superMiscConds.notes: Must not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.
